title: Description of the `oft` data object
text: reference points numeric outcomes toxicological ecotoxicological studies, described “critical toxicological studies reference points …” (Dorne et al. 2021). Apparently, means certain category reference points, critical value selected reported. Also, seems pesticidal active substances, reference points representative formulations also available EFSA outputs listed. number reference points study type shown . Example code extracting printing reference points springtail species Folsomia candida:
code: head(oft$reference_points) |>   knitr::kable() sort(table(oft$reference_points$Study), decreasing = TRUE) #>  #>                       Human health         Ecotox (water compartment)  #>                               4019                               3298  #> Animal (non-target species) health          Ecotox (soil compartment)  #>                               3093                               2638  #>     Animal (target species) health  #>                                578 # Collect endpoints on springtails springtail_endpoints <- oft$reference_points |>   dplyr::filter(Species == "Folsomia candida") |>   select(Substance, DurationDays, Endpoint, qualifier, value, unit, Effect) head(springtail_endpoints) |>   knitr::kable()

title: Description of the `oft` data object
text: reference values show outcome substance specific assessment. number reference values available frequent assessment types shown . examples Predicted -Effect Concentration (PNEC) data can easily extracted.
code: sort(table(oft$reference_values$Assessment), decreasing = TRUE)[1:10] #>  #>                        MSI/FC            TTC Cramer Class I  #>                          3692                          2505  #>                           ADI critical study not identified  #>                           915                           864  #>           TTC Cramer Class II                          ARfD  #>                           691                           587  #>                          AOEL                            UL  #>                           509                           274  #>          TTC Cramer Class III                          PNEC  #>                           205                           190 PNEC_values <- oft$reference_values |>   dplyr::filter(Assessment == "PNEC") head(PNEC_values) |>   knitr::kable()

title: Description of the `oft` data object
text: table contains substance names serves reference table reference points reference values.

title: Description of the `oft` data object
text: table, substance characterisation data collected1. exact meaning differenct values column component_type (originally named ) seem documented.

title: Description of the `oft` data object
text: table referred tables containing reference points referenec values. shows bibliographic information documents served data sources OpenFoodTox project.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Johannes Ranke. Author, maintainer. Elisabeth Lutz. Contributor. Romualdus Kasteel. Reviewer. Marcel Mathis. Reviewer. European Food Safety Authority. Data contributor. Agroscope. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ranke J (2024). OpenFoodTox: EFSA OpenFoodTox Data Made Accessible R Package. R package version 0.1.3, https://agroscope-ch.github.io/openfoodtox.
code: @Manual{,   title = {OpenFoodTox: EFSA OpenFoodTox Data Made Accessible as an R Package},   author = {Johannes Ranke},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.3},   url = {https://agroscope-ch.github.io/openfoodtox}, }

what: EFSA OpenFoodTox Data Made Accessible as an R Package
title: EFSA OpenFoodTox Data Made Accessible as an R Package
text: R package provides convenient access data extracted spreadsheet files made available OpenFoodTox, chemical hazards database European Food Safety Authority (EFSA). original files published Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International licence can accessed via EFSA website directly Zenodo. core component package data object oft, contains data four OpenFoodTox spreadsheets currently relevant group Agroscope. spreadsheets substance characterisation, EFSA outputs, reference points reference values. using R package, data available form dm object. Basically, dm object list tables defined relations.

title: EFSA OpenFoodTox Data Made Accessible as an R Package
text: online documentation available github. graphical representation tables relations usage examples shown documentation oft object. addition, package vignette oft object, describing contents individual tables. information relational data models implemented dm package, please refer online documentation.

title: EFSA OpenFoodTox Data Made Accessible as an R Package
text: can load package R using data object oft available.

what: Connected tables of data published in OpenFoodTox — oft
title: Connected tables of data published in OpenFoodTox — oft
text: data object created facilitate access list -called 'reference points' published part OpenFoodTox datasets (Carnesecchi et al. 2023). reference points linked substance characterisations outputs European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) data published. Also, table 'reference values' included, also linked substance characterisations EFSA outputs. data tables published part OpenFoodTox included R package.

text: Carnesecchi E, Mostrag , Ciacci , Roncaglioni , Tarkhov , Gibin D, Sartori L, Benfenati E, Yang C, Dorne JLCM (2023). OpenFoodTox: EFSA's chemical hazards database (Version 5). Zenodo. doi:10.5281/zenodo.8120114 Dorne JLCM, Richardson J, Livaniou , Carnesecchi E, Ceriani L, Baldin R, Kovarich S, Pavan M, Saouter E, Biganzoli F, Pasinato L, Zare Jeddi M, Robinson TP, Kass GEN, Liem AKD, Toropov AA, Toropova AP, Yang C, Tarkhov , Georgiadis N, Di Nicola MR, Mostrag , Verhagen H, Roncaglioni , Benfenati E, Bassan . EFSA's OpenFoodTox: open source toxicological database chemicals food feed future developments. Environ Int. 2021 Jan;146:106293. doi:10.1016/j.envint.2020.106293

title: Aquatic Cyanobacteria — oft_aq_cyanobacteria
code: print(oft_aq_cyanobacteria) #> [1] "Anabaena flosaquae"                         #> [2] "Anabaena variabilis"                        #> [3] "Aphanizomenon flos-aquae Ralfs ex Bornet &" #> [4] "Microcystis aeruginosa"

title: Fish — oft_aq_fish
code: print(oft_aq_fish) #>  [1] "Rainbow trout"            "Bluegill"                 #>  [3] "Fathead minnow"           "Sheepshead minnow"        #>  [5] "Common carp"              "Zebra fish"               #>  [7] "Red seabream"             "American flag fish"       #>  [9] "Brook trout"              "Brown trout"              #> [11] "Ide"                      "Louisiana crayfish"       #> [13] "Atlantic salmon"          "Channel catfish"          #> [15] "Guppy"                    "European perch"           #> [17] "Inland silverside"        "Mosquitofish"             #> [19] "Three-spined stickleback" "Mozambique tilapia"       #> [21] "Spot croaker"             "Japanese rice fish"       #> [23] "Crucian carp"             "Yellow bullhead catfish"

"Palaemonetes kadlakensis" #> [15] "Chironomus tentans"       "Daggerblade grass Shrimp" #> [17] "Gammarus pseudolimnaeus"  "Gammarus pulex"           #> [19] "Northern quahog"          "Chironomus yoshimatsui"   #> [21] "Gastropoda - Gastropods"

what: Group species names occurring in reference points — oft_group_species
title: Group species names occurring in reference points — oft_group_species
text: Convenience function group species fish, aquatic invertebrates, aquatic primary producers, birds, mammals, bees, earthworms, arthropods plants. entries 'Unspecified' 'reported' translated NA.

title: Group species names occurring in reference points — oft_group_species
Group species names occurring in reference points — oft_group_species
text: species species name, .e. Species column referenec point table

title: Group species names occurring in reference points — oft_group_species
Group species names occurring in reference points — oft_group_species
code: library(dplyr) oft$reference_points |>   dplyr::filter(Substance == "Thiacloprid") |>   mutate(Species_group = oft_group_species(Species)) |>   select(Substance, Species, Species_group, Endpoint, qualifier, value, unit, Effect) #> # A tibble: 26 × 8 #>    Substance   Species     Species_group Endpoint qualifier   value unit  Effect #>    <chr>       <chr>       <chr>         <chr>    <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <chr>  #>  1 Thiacloprid Canary      birds         NOAEL    =          15     mg/k… morta… #>  2 Thiacloprid Rat         mammals       LD50     =         177     mg/k… morta… #>  3 Thiacloprid Canary      birds         LD50     =           3.5   mg/k… not r… #>  4 Thiacloprid Rat         mammals       NOAEL    =           3.3   mg/k… repro… #>  5 Thiacloprid Aphidius r… arthropods    ER50     >           0.95  g/ha  morta… #>  6 Thiacloprid Honey bee   bees          LD50     =          38.8   µg/p… morta… #>  7 Thiacloprid Honey bee   bees          LD50     =          17.3   µg/p… morta… #>  8 Thiacloprid Tiger worm  soil_macroor… LC50     =         105     mg/kg morta… #>  9 Thiacloprid Typhlodrom… arthropods    LR50     =           0.331 g/ha  morta… #> 10 Thiacloprid Red tiger … soil_macroor… EC10     =           0.04  mg/kg repro… #> # ℹ 16 more rows

title: OpenFoodTox 0.1.4
text: Reorganize add species lists aquatic reference points Rename vignette describing data object ‘OpenFoodTox.rmd’ linked “Get started” online documentation

title: OpenFoodTox 0.1.2 (2024-01-22)
text: Initial release github, containing substance characterisation, EFSA outputs, reference points reference values Version 6 (published September 13, 2023) OpenFoodTox database
